name: Window Covering
description: The window covering cluster provides an interface for controlling and adjusting automatic window coverings such as drapery motors, automatic shades, curtains and blinds.

history.description: Mandatory global ClusterRevision attribute added; CCB 1994 1995 1996 1997 2086 2094 2095 2096 2097
All Hubs changes with FeatureMap & OperationalStatus attribute
New data model format and notation. Created plus clarified PositionAware and AbsolutePosition features. General cleanup of functionality.

LF.name: Lift
LF.summary: Lift control and behavior for lifting/sliding window coverings

TL.name: Tilt
TL.summary: Tilt control and behavior for tilting window coverings

PA_LF.name: PositionAwareLift
PA_LF.summary: Position aware lift control is supported.

PA_TL.name: PositionAwareTilt
PA_TL.summary: Position aware tilt control is supported.

OperationalStatusBitmap.description: The OperationalStatusBitmap is using several internal operational state fields (composed of 2 bits) following this definition: 00b = Currently not moving, 01b = Currently opening (e.g. moving from closed to open), 10b = Currently closing (e.g. moving from open to closed), 11b = Reserved

0.name: RemoteLockout
0.summary: Movement commands are ignored (locked out). e.g. not granted authorization, outside some time/date range.

1.name: TamperDetection
1.summary: Tampering detected on sensors or any other safety equipment. Ex: a device has been forcedly moved without its actuator(s).

2.name: FailedCommunication
2.summary: Communication failure to sensors or other safety equipment.

3.name: PositionFailure
3.summary: Device has failed to reach the desired position. e.g. with position aware device, time expired before TargetPosition is reached.

4.name: ThermalProtection
4.summary: Motor(s) and/or electric circuit thermal protection activated.

5.name: ObstacleDetected
5.summary: An obstacle is preventing actuator movement.

6.name: Power
6.summary: Device has power related issue or limitation e.g. device is running w/ the help of a backup battery or power might not be fully available at the moment.

7.name: StopInput
7.summary: Local safety sensor (not a direct obstacle) is preventing movements (e.g. Safety EU Standard EN60335).

8.name: MotorJammed
8.summary: Mechanical problem related to the motor(s) detected.

9.name: HardwareFailure
9.summary: PCB, fuse and other electrics problems.

10.name: ManualOperation
10.summary: Actuator is manually operated and is preventing actuator movement (e.g. actuator is disengaged/decoupled).

0x0000.name: Type
0x0000.description: This attribute SHALL identify the type of window covering.

0x0001.name: PhysicalClosedLimitLift
0x0001.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the maximum possible encoder position possible (Unit cm, centimeters) to position the height of the window covering lift.

0x0002.name: PhysicalClosedLimitTilt
0x0002.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the maximum possible encoder position possible (Unit 0.1°, tenths of a degree) to position the angle of the window covering tilt.

0x0003.name: CurrentPositionLift
0x0003.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the actual lift position (Unit cm, centimeters) of the window covering from the fully-open position.

0x0004.name: CurrentPositionTilt
0x0004.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the actual tilt position (Unit 0.1°, tenths of a degree) of the window covering from the fully-open position.

0x0005.name: NumberOfActuationsLift
0x0005.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the total number of lift/slide actuations applied to the window covering since the device was installed.

0x0006.name: NumberOfActuationsTilt
0x0006.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the total number of tilt actuations applied to the window covering since the device was installed.

0x0007.name: ConfigStatus
0x0007.description: This attribute specifies the configuration and status information of the window covering.

0x0008.name: CurrentPositionLiftPercentage
0x0008.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the actual position as a percentage from 0% to 100% with 1% default step.

0x0009.name: CurrentPositionTiltPercentage
0x0009.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the actual position as a percentage from 0% to 100% with 1% default step.

0x000A.name: OperationalStatus
0x000A.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the currently ongoing operations and applies to all type of devices.

0x000B.name: TargetPositionLiftPercent100ths
0x000B.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the position where the window covering lift will go or is moving to as a percentage (Unit 0.01%).

0x000C.name: TargetPositionTiltPercent100ths
0x000C.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the position where the window covering tilt will go or is moving to as a percentage (Unit 0.01%).

0x000D.name: EndProductType
0x000D.description: This attribute SHOULD provide more detail about the product type than can be determined from the main category indicated by the Type attribute.

0x000E.name: CurrentPositionLiftPercent100ths
0x000E.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the actual position as a percentage with a minimal step of 0.01%. E.g Max 10000 equals 100.00%.

0x000F.name: CurrentPositionTiltPercent100ths
0x000F.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the actual position as a percentage with a minimal step of 0.01%. E.g Max 10000 equals 100.00%.

0x0010.name: InstalledOpenLimitLift
0x0010.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the open limit for lifting the window covering whether position (in centimeters) is encoded or timed.

0x0011.name: InstalledClosedLimitLift
0x0011.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the closed limit for lifting the window covering whether position (in centimeters) is encoded or timed.

0x0012.name: InstalledOpenLimitTilt
0x0012.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the open limit for tilting the window covering whether position (in tenth of a degree) is encoded or timed.

0x0013.name: InstalledClosedLimitTilt
0x0013.description: This attribute SHALL indicate the closed limit for tilting the window covering whether position (in tenth of a degree) is encoded or timed.

0x0017.name: Mode
0x0017.description: The Mode attribute allows configuration of the window covering, such as: reversing the motor direction, placing the window covering into calibration mode, placing the motor into maintenance mode, disabling the network, and disabling status LEDs.

0x001A.name: SafetyStatus
0x001A.description: The SafetyStatus attribute reflects the state of the safety sensors and the common issues preventing movements.

0x00.name: UpOrOpen
0x00.description: Upon receipt of this command, the window covering will adjust its position so the physical lift/slide and tilt is at the maximum open/up position. This will happen as fast as possible.

0x01.name: DownOrClose
0x01.description: Upon receipt of this command, the window covering will adjust its position so the physical lift/slide and tilt is at the maximum closed/down position. This will happen as fast as possible.

0x02.name: StopMotion
0x02.description: Upon receipt of this command, the window covering will stop any adjusting to the physical tilt and lift/slide that is currently occurring.

0x04.name: GoToLiftValue
0x04.description: This command causes the window covering to adjust the lift position to the specified value.

0x05.name: GoToLiftPercentage
0x05.description: Upon receipt of this command, the server will adjust the window covering to the lift/slide percentage specified in the payload of this command.

0x07.name: GoToTiltValue
0x07.description: This command causes the window covering to adjust the tilt position to the specified value.

0x08.name: GoToTiltPercentage
0x08.description: Upon receipt of this command, the server will adjust the window covering to the tilt percentage specified in the payload of this command.
